meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to detonate.
meanings.sent1: The detonability of the fireworks made the show spectacular.
meanings.sent2: The bomb's detonability was a cause for concern among the experts.
meanings.sent3: The detonability of the firecrackers startled the cat, making it jump.
meanings.sent4: The detonability of the situation was like a ticking time bomb waiting to go off.
meanings.sent5: The detonability of the chemicals in the lab was carefully monitored by the scientists.

meanings.definition: The ability to explode or cause an explosion.
meanings.sent1: The detonability of the gas leak led to a dangerous situation.
meanings.sent2: The military experts studied the detonability of different types of explosives.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's detonability with firecrackers always caused chaos in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room had a palpable detonability, ready to erupt at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The volcano's detonability was a constant threat to the nearby town.
